content.title: Regional Centre for Training and Production of Mushroom
content.details: The scheme 'Regional Centre for Training and Production of Mushroom' was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to train farmers in the method of mushroom cultivation and to supply quality spawn and pasteurised compost to farmers.
benefits: Construction of compost shed with 50% assistance
Financial assistance to Mushroom growers @ ₹22,000/- per unit
eligibility: The applicant/farmer should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 (hectares) or more.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper and submit it at the nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer.
documents_required: Documents proof of possessing own or leased land

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to train farmers in the method of mushroom cultivation and to supply quality spawn and pasteurised compost to farmers.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Supply of Button, Oyster spawns, Supply of compost to Mushroom growers, Construction of compost shed, Financial assistance to Mushroom growers.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Supply of Mushroom spawns at 50% subsidy, Supply of Compost at 50% subsidy, Construction of compost shed- 50% assistance, Financial assistance to Mushroom growers @ ₹22,000/- per unit.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares or more are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide and progressive farmers shall be selected on a first come first serve basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer: District Horticulture Officer, Assistant Director of Horticulture (Mushroom) Upper Shillong.
